alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 9:40AM CDT until July 25 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... North Platte River at North Platte affecting Lincoln County. For the North Platte River...including North Platte...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR THE NORTH PLATTE RIVER AT NORTH PLATTE NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam releases from Kingsley Dam continues. * WHERE...North Platte River at North Platte. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Minor flooding begins in low lying and agricultural areas along the south bank of the North Platte River. Flooding of yards between the golf course and Buffalo Bill Campground are possible. Minor water intrusions into low lying areas of Cody Park in North Platte begins. People should use caution in the water and along the banks of the river, especially near Cody Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Sunday was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage after midnight tonight and continue falling to 5.8 feet Monday morning. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
